titles.title: To regulate fishing in certain waters of Alaska.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-687.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 356.

action.text: Mr. Calvert moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 596.

action.text: By Senator Murkowski from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 104-390.

bill.summary: 7/30/1996--Passed House amended. Permits local residents who are descendants of Katmai residents who lived in the Naknek Lake and River Drainage to continue their traditional fishery for red fish in Katmai National Park (the national park and national preserve redesignated, established, and expanded under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act).
